topics.body:
For summer I plan to do a trip Washington State. Last time I went on a hike, it was through this narrow path with strong current and literally ice-cold water (as in from melted snow)

!http://www.chrisdickinsonphotography.com/img/s2/v53/p942265770-5.jpg!

Next hike would be through that pretty forest trail in Washington

!http://www.miguelvieira.org/rememberedearth/wp-content/uploads/2010/07/Olympic-National-Park-Cape-Alava-Trail.jpg!

I'm starting to run out of places to go within 3-4 days driving range to travel though.

topics.body:
Heeeey Traveling!

One question, anyone ever want to visit at least one creepy place on this big blue marble we call Earth one of these days just because?

For me I would love to visit either 

The Door Way to Hell

!http://wallpaperpassion.com/upload1/37749/door-to-hell-wallpaper.jpg!

Basically, a natural gas site in Derweze, Turkmenistan which was discovered accidently in a bid for oil then burnt in an effort to stop the gases from polluting the area. Though to last only a week... It has been burning for 40+ years already.

or

Kryziu Kalnas in Lithuania

!http://ims.mii.lt/asmen/rimga/albumas/boi2005/050506-120818-IMG_3708.jpg!

Basically, just a Hill of Crosses set up in just one area as a pilgrimage site. I think it was bulldozed twice in the cold war by the Soviets and gave up when the locals set up more crosses than they could destroy.
topics.author: 4ffdaf9e7f123b505400025f

topics.body:
"@Princess♥Luna":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5380395c6368727b5c580000#post_5380395c6368727b5c580000
I hope it continues to burn for another few decades. It would suck if it runs out before I can go.

Haven't heard of the Hill of Crosses. Looks like a neat place and not too creepy. 8/10 will visit.

For one of the thrilling places to experience: Devil's pool.

!http://thesuiteworld.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/Devils_Pool_Victoria_Falls_Zambia_Zimbabwe_travel_thesuiteworld.jpg!

Yup, that's the edge of a waterfall. The Victoria waterfall, to be exact.
